revised_title: Equilibrium Statistics of a Clustering Process in the Uncondensed Phase
tldr: This article explores the equilibrium statistics of a clustering process in the uncondensed phase, where particles can associate and dissociate to form clusters. The study focuses on models of organic polymers, virus-antibody reactions, and the cluster theory of imperfect gases and liquids. The author presents a method to determine the complete statistical distribution of cluster sizes in equilibrium, considering various types of units and their interconnections.
